info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 01 at 4:05PM CDT by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Pecos and southeastern Reeves Counties through 445 PM CDT... At 405 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Saragosa, or 16 miles south of Toyah, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Saragosa, Toyah Lake and Verhalen. This includes Interstate 10 between mile markers 209 and 214. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for southwestern Texas.
